FuncDef: Using the display arp-limit command, you can view the maximum number of ARP entries that an interface can learn.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the maximum number of ARP entries that can be learnt by the interface.
-

Displays the maximum number of ARP entries that can be learnt by the VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the number of ARP entries that the device learns has reached the upper limit, it will cause some users unable to use the network normally, you can run this command to view the maximum number of ARP entries that each interface can learn and the number of ARP entries that each interface has learned.
Precautions
If you use this command on a Layer 2 or Layer 3 interface, both the maximum number of ARP entries that the Layer 2 or Layer 3 interface can learn and the number of ARP entries that the main control board has learnt are displayed.
